title: US Navy Confronts China John Batchelor 05112016.mp3
description:
US Navy Confronts China. @gordongchang. @jerryhendrix11. Zack Cooper, Center for Strategic and International Studies. Kelley Sayler, CNAS. Commander Brendan Stickles, USN

John Batchelor May 11 , 2016 podcast - MP3 format

#China scrambled fighter jets on Tuesday as a U.S. navy ship sailed close to a disputed reef in the #SouthChinaSea, a patrol China denounced as an illegal threat to peace which only went to show its defense installations in the area were necessary.

â€œGuided missile destroyer the USS William P. Lawrence traveled within 12 nautical miles (22 km) of Chinese-occupied #FieryCross Reef, U.S. Defense Department spokesman Bill Urban said.

â€œThe so-called freedom of navigation operation was undertaken to "challenge excessive maritime claims" by China, #Taiwan, and #Vietnam which were seeking to restrict navigation rights in the South China Sea, Urban said.

"These excessive maritime claims are inconsistent with international law as reflected in the Law of the Sea Convention in that they purport to restrict the navigation rights that the United States and all states are entitled to exercise," Urban said in an emailed statement.

â€œChina and the United States have traded accusations of militarizing the South China Sea as China undertakes large-scale land reclamation and construction on disputed features while the United States has increased its patrols and exercisesâ€¦.â€
